entry.title: Mesopotamian chronicles
entry.content:
Mesopotamian chronicles
The Assyrianand Babylonianchronicles are historiographical texts from ancient Mesopotamia. Although they contain references to the earliest times, they deal especially with the second half of the second and the entire first millennium down to the first century BCE (cf. this table). On this page, you will find
  • links to translations of all known chronicles; they are meant as a first introduction and for ready reference, but it is advisable not to quote them without consulting a printed edition, because many readings are still uncertain;
  • new editions of the chronicles of the Seleucidand Parthianperiod; several of them have not been published before...
